programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 2 Alabama (20-3, 9-1) won six-straight games behind the top scoring offense in the country, averaging 90 ppg behind Mark Sears; Texas (15-9, 4-7) is 10-4 at home this season behind Tre Johnson, who leads the SEC in scoring with 19 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 5 Tennessee (20-4, 7-4) is third in the country in scoring defense, allowing 59.2 ppg; No. 15 Kentucky (16-7, 5-5) won four of the last five meetings after a 78-73 win on Jan. 28 behind 18 points from Koby Brea and 17 from Jaxson Robinson.

programme.title: Abdullah Mason: Appetite for Smoke
programme.desc: One of the top up-and-coming lightweight boxers, Abdullah Mason uses an entertaining boxing style to start his career undefeated and pursuing more, bigger names as he looks to add a title to his accolades in becoming a household name.

programme.title: Good Guy/Bad Guy
programme.desc: UFC heavyweight and light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier and UFC Hall of Fame member Chael Sonnen break down the latest from around the MMA world, recapping recent marquee events, the latest injury updates and guest interviews.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: The Hoop Collective
programme.desc: Brian Windhorst and a group of ESPN insiders cover anything and everything from around the NBA, breaking down the latest stories making headlines, recapping and previewing marquee matchups, and interviewing guests to gather their thoughts.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Santa Clara (17-9, 9-4) won three-straight games; Saint Mary's (21-4, 11-1) is 12-1 at home this season, and won the last seven meetings with the Broncos after a 67-54 win on Jan. 29 behind 12 points from Mitchell Saxen and 10 from Luke Barrett.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 3 Florida (20-3, 7-3) won five of its last six games after a 90-81 win over then-No. 1 Auburn behind 19 points from Walter Clayton Jr., and won three of the last four meetings; No. 22 Mississippi State (17-6, 5-5) is 8-3 at home this season.

programme.title: Top Rank Boxing on ESPN
programme.desc: Started in 1973 by Bob Arum and Jabir Herbert Muhammad, Top Rank Boxing showcases some of the biggest names in the sport as one of the premier promoters, as fighters move up the rankings in their weight classes to earn a title bout.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Joining the list of memorable defense lines with even more memorable nicknames in NFL history, Mark Gastineau, Joe Klecko, Marty Lyons and Abdul Salaam formed one of the most dominant defensive lines in NFL history for the New York Jets in the 1980s.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Colorado (9-14, 0-12) lost 12-straight games since beating Bellarmine, 79-55, on Dec. 21; No. 17 Kansas (16-7, 7-5) dropped three of its last five games, but is 11-2 at home behind Hunter Dickinson, who is fourth in the Big 12 with 16.5 ppg.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Texas and Kentucky previously met on Nov. 24, 2007, where the Longhorns claimed a 72-60 victory over the Wildcats behind 17 points and 4 rebounds from Brittainey Raven; Samantha Mahoney posted 12 points and 2 steals for Kentucky in the loss.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 14 Memphis (20-4, 10-1) won seven-straight games behind PJ Haggerty, who is second in the AAC with 21.6 ppg; USF (12-12, 5-6) is 9-3 at home behind Jamille Reynolds, and beat the Tigers last season, 74-73, after losing the previous five meetings.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: The latest news and updates surrounding the fighters competing in the upcoming UFC event are featured, breaking down the fight card with in-depth analysis of the premier matches highlighting the event, along with profiles of the combatants.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The New York Knicks, led by Walt Frazier, Earl Monroe, Willis Reed, Bill Bradley and Dave DeBusschere, would capture the imagination of New York City during a colorful and volatile era with their scrappy but dazzling style and amazing teamwork.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series Practice
programme.desc: Cup Series drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency for the Daytona 500; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: The Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: The FOX Sports team shares coverage of the 2021 Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show as the canine competitors and their owners hope to be crowned the top spot in their respective classes before the coveted Best in Show award is given.

programme.title: The Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: The FOX Sports team shares coverage of the 2021 Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show as the canine competitors and their owners hope to be crowned the top spot in their respective classes before the coveted Best in Show award is given.

programme.title: The Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: The FOX Sports team shares coverage of the 2021 Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show as the canine competitors and their owners hope to be crowned the top spot in their respective classes before the coveted Best in Show award is given.

programme.title: The Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: The FOX Sports team shares coverage of the 2021 Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show as the canine competitors and their owners hope to be crowned the top spot in their respective classes before the coveted Best in Show award is given.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 9 St. John's (21-3, 12-1) won 10-straight games, including an 80-68 win over the Wildcats on Jan. 11 behind 30 points from RJ Luis Jr.; Villanova (14-10, 7-6) is 11-3 at home behind Eric Dixon, who leads the country in scoring with 23.8 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Colorado State (15-8, 9-3) won five of its last six games behind Nique Clifford, and won four of the last six meetings; Utah State (21-3, 11-2) is 11-2 at home this season behind Ian Martinez, who is fifth in the Mountain West in scoring with 17 ppg.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series Practice
programme.desc: Cup Series drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency for the Daytona 500; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Wyoming (11-12, 4-8) dropped six of its last eight games; New Mexico (20-4, 12-1) won six straight, and won its last four meetings with the Cowboys after a 61-53 win on Jan. 7 behind 22 points from Donovan Dent, who leads Mountain West scoring.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay
programme.desc: RaceDay previews the Duel at Daytona, along with Tyler Reddick and Christopher Bell, who won the two 60-lap races last year, going over the latest news from pit road and updated track conditions, along with their predictions on the race.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series Practice
programme.desc: Truck Series drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the truck is handling and what adjustments need to be made to perform at peak efficiency for the Fresh From Florida 250; crews work to set up the truck.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series Qualifying
programme.desc: NASCAR Cup drivers aim for a spot on the front row for the Daytona 500 with one of the two fastest times, while the rest of the field is then placed in one of the Duel at Daytona races to determine the rest of the grid for the season opener.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series Qualifying
programme.desc: NASCAR Cup drivers aim for a spot on the front row for the Daytona 500 with one of the two fastest times, while the rest of the field is then placed in one of the Duel at Daytona races to determine the rest of the grid for the season opener.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Classic
programme.desc: Jeff Gordon was coming off his second Cup Series title in three years, including a win at the 1997 Daytona 500, while seven-time Cup Series champion Dale Earnhardt sought his first win at the prestigious race that continued to elude him.

programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series Qualifying
programme.desc: NASCAR Truck Series drivers qualify for the Fresh From Florida 250, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded the pole position; Ty Majeski averaged 178.767 mph en route to winning the pole last year but would finish the race in 15th place.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in second event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Brendan Steele won the individual crown with a one-shot victory over Louis Oosthuizen, while Ripper GC beat Stinger GC in a playoff for the team crown in last year's edition.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: NFL Films Presents
programme.desc: The National Football League presents a closer, documentary-style look at the teams and towns featured prominently each Sunday in the league, as well as a look at the most enigmatic personalities of the league and the impressive plays of the weekend.

programme.title: The Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: The FOX Sports team shares coverage of the 2021 Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show as the canine competitors and their owners hope to be crowned the top spot in their respective classes before the coveted Best in Show award is given.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Colorado State (15-8, 9-3) won five of its last six games behind Nique Clifford, and won four of the last six meetings; Utah State (21-3, 11-2) is 11-2 at home this season behind Ian Martinez, who is fifth in the Mountain West in scoring with 17 ppg.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Cruz Azul won the first-ever meeting with its 2-0 victory at Estadio Cibao in the first leg matchup on Feb. 4, as Ángel Sepúlveda notched in the 38th minute, while Jimmylson Guillaume had an own goal in the 83rd minute for Real Hope FA.

programme.title: AMSOIL Championship Snocross Series
programme.desc: The top competitors from around the world compete in the AMSOIL Championship Snocross Series, the premier snowmobile racing event in North America, featuring racers competing on a track with big jumps, highlights of top moments and interviews.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Forge FC is 0-0-5 all-time in the competition; Monterrey won the inaugural encounter against the Hammers with a 2-0 triumph in the first leg matchup on Feb. 5, as Nelson Deossa and Jordi Cortizo each found the back of the net in the second half.

programme.title: Inside the Big East
programme.desc: Insiders and journalists provide a detailed look inside all the action around the Big East, including highlights from the biggest games, discussions on relevant sports topics, previews of upcoming matchups, player profiles, and much more.

programme.title: AMSOIL Championship Snocross Series
programme.desc: The top competitors from around the world compete in the AMSOIL Championship Snocross Series, the premier snowmobile racing event in North America, featuring racers competing on a track with big jumps, highlights of top moments and interviews.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: EJ Tackett, who looks to win his 25th career title and move into a tie with Brian Voss for 11th all-time, leads the tour in points through two events; Graham Fach won the season opener.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Classic
programme.desc: Kyle Petty earned the pole position in a Pontiac and started on the front row alongside Dale Jarrett in a Chevrolet, while Jeff Gordon and Dale Earnhardt won the 125-mile qualifiers and started on Row 2 for the 200-lap race around the 2.5-mile oval.

programme.title: The Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: The FOX Sports team shares coverage of the 2021 Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show as the canine competitors and their owners hope to be crowned the top spot in their respective classes before the coveted Best in Show award is given.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: The Dominican Republic is coming off of defeats in both of their friendly matches with Costa Rica in Dec., losing the final matchup, 3-0; Grenada claimed a 2-0 victory over the US Virgin Islands on March 24, 2019, with a Benjamin Ettienne brace.

programme.title: A Perfect Storm: 1979 Daytona 500
programme.desc: The first 500-mile race to be televised live in its entirety on national television drew a captive audience after a snowstorm hit most of the Northeast; Cale Yarborough, Richard Petty, and Donnie Allison were part of an exciting and memorable finish.

programme.desc: NASCAR Cup drivers aim for a spot on the front row for the Daytona 500 with one of the two fastest times, while the rest of the field is then placed in one of the Duel at Daytona races to determine the rest of the grid for the season opener.

programme.desc: Forge FC is 0-0-5 all-time in the competition; Monterrey won the inaugural encounter against the Hammers with a 2-0 triumph in the first leg matchup on Feb. 5, as Nelson Deossa and Jordi Cortizo each found the back of the net in the second half.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 9 St. John's (21-3, 12-1) won 10-straight games, including an 80-68 win over the Wildcats on Jan. 11 behind 30 points from RJ Luis Jr.; Villanova (14-10, 7-6) is 11-3 at home behind Eric Dixon, who leads the country in scoring with 23.8 ppg.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Forge FC is 0-0-5 all-time in the competition; Monterrey won the inaugural encounter against the Hammers with a 2-0 triumph in the first leg matchup on Feb. 5, as Nelson Deossa and Jordi Cortizo each found the back of the net in the second half.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Canada claimed a 4-0 victory over Curaçao in the CONCACAF Championship round of 16 in 2019, led by a goal and assist from Kamron Habibullah; Simon Colyn and Jayden Nelson rounded out the scoring in the win along with an Elijah Nava own-goal.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: Coverage of top-tier rugby in Australia and New Zealand.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Real Estelí FC improved to 1-1-1 all-time in the series against Tigres UNAL after securing a 1-0 victory at Estadio Independencia in the first leg matchup on Feb. 5, as Francisco Grahl scored off an assist from Harold Medina in the 83rd minute.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Guadalajara overcame a one-goal deficit late in the first leg matchup at Estadio Cibao on Feb. 6 to earn a 1-1 draw against Cibao, as Luis Rey scored off an assist from Yael Padilla for the equalizer 10 minutes in second-half stoppage time.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Mexico is coming off of claiming an 8-0 victory over Dominica in World Cup qualification on Feb. 9, led by a brace from Aldo De Nigris after 75 minutes; Barbados suffered a 6-0 defeat to Nicaragua on Feb. 7 where they conceded three goals per half.

programme.title: 26th Annual Super Bowl Soulful Celebration
programme.desc: Professional football players and Grammy award-winning musicians share inspiring messages at the Mahalia Jackson Theater of Performing Arts in New Orleans.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in second event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Brendan Steele won the individual crown with a one-shot victory over Louis Oosthuizen, while Ripper GC beat Stinger GC in a playoff for the team crown in last year's edition.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Two 60-lap races determine the final 38 positions on the starting grid for the Daytona 500; Tyler Reddick and Christopher Bell won the two races last year, and a Duel winner has won the "The Great American Race" on nine separate occasions.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Cavalry FC overcame a one-goal deficit in the second half to secure a 2-1 triumph over Pumas UNAM in the first leg matchup on Feb. 6, as Charlie Trafford scored the equalizer, while Tobias Warschewski scored the match-winner in the 80th minute.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: United States's last action was a 3-2 loss to Germany in the World Cup round of 16 on Nov. 21, 2023, where Taha Habroune and David Vazquez had their goals; Saint Kitts and Nevis lost to the Dominican Republic, 5-1, in 2022 Championship qualification.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: The American Contender Tournament offers qualifying rounds across eight rodeo disciplines: Tie-Down Roping, Steer Wrestling, Saddle Bronc Riding, Bareback Riding, Barrel Racing, Break Away Roping, Team Roping and Bull Riding.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Ty Majeski won the finale at Phoenix last year over Corey Heim to claim his first Truck Series Championship; Nick Sanchez averaged 98.933 mph en route to his win in the opener last year, beating Heim under caution for his first Truck Series win.

programme.title: The Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: The FOX Sports team shares coverage of the 2021 Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show as the canine competitors and their owners hope to be crowned the top spot in their respective classes before the coveted Best in Show award is given.

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Hilal claimed a 3-0 victory over Al-Riyadh in their first meeting of the season on Sept. 14, led by a goal and assist from Salem Al-Dawsari; Aleksandar Mitrović found the third goal of the match after an own-goal from Yoann Barbet.

programme.title: The Masters Agility Championship at Westminster
programme.desc: Over 300 dogs compete in two qualifying rounds consisting of a Standard Agility and a Jumper with Weaves course, with the 10 dogs with the highest combined scores from each of the five height classes advancing; Nimble, a mixed-breed dog, won in 2024.
